options.title: +FIRST_PAGE[:LAST_PAGE], --pages=FIRST_PAGE[:LAST_PAGE]
options.description: begin [stop] printing with page FIRST_[LAST_]PAGE

options.title: -COLUMN, --columns=COLUMN
options.description: output COLUMN columns and print columns down, unless -a is used. Balance number of lines in the columns on each page

options.title: -a, --across
options.description: print columns across rather than down, used together with -COLUMN

options.title: -a, --across
options.description: print columns across rather than down, used together with -COLUMN

options.title: -c, --show-control-chars
options.description: use hat notation (^G) and octal backslash notation

options.title: -c, --show-control-chars
options.description: use hat notation (^G) and octal backslash notation

options.title: -d, --double-space
options.description: double space the output

options.title: -d, --double-space
options.description: double space the output

options.title: -D, --date-format=FORMAT
options.description: use FORMAT for the header date

options.title: -D, --date-format=FORMAT
options.description: use FORMAT for the header date

options.title: -e[CHAR[WIDTH]], --expand-tabs[=CHAR[WIDTH]]
options.description: expand input CHARs (TABs) to tab WIDTH (8)

options.title: -e[CHAR[WIDTH]], --expand-tabs[=CHAR[WIDTH]]
options.description: expand input CHARs (TABs) to tab WIDTH (8)

options.title: -F, -f, --form-feed
options.description: use form feeds instead of newlines to separate pages (by a 3-line page header with -F or a 5-line header and trailer without -F)

options.title: -F, -f, --form-feed
options.description: use form feeds instead of newlines to separate pages (by a 3-line page header with -F or a 5-line header and trailer without -F)

options.title: -F, -f, --form-feed
options.description: use form feeds instead of newlines to separate pages (by a 3-line page header with -F or a 5-line header and trailer without -F)

options.title: -h, --header=HEADER
options.description: use a centered HEADER instead of filename in page header, -h "" prints a blank line, don't use -h""

options.title: -h, --header=HEADER
options.description: use a centered HEADER instead of filename in page header, -h "" prints a blank line, don't use -h""

options.title: -i[CHAR[WIDTH]], --output-tabs[=CHAR[WIDTH]]
options.description: replace spaces with CHARs (TABs) to tab WIDTH (8)

options.title: -i[CHAR[WIDTH]], --output-tabs[=CHAR[WIDTH]]
options.description: replace spaces with CHARs (TABs) to tab WIDTH (8)

options.title: -J, --join-lines
options.description: merge full lines, turns off -W line truncation, no column alignment, --sep-string[=STRING] sets separators

options.title: -J, --join-lines
options.description: merge full lines, turns off -W line truncation, no column alignment, --sep-string[=STRING] sets separators

options.title: -l, --length=PAGE_LENGTH
options.description: set the page length to PAGE_LENGTH (66) lines (default number of lines of text 56, and with -F 63). implies -t if PAGE_LENGTH <= 10

options.title: -l, --length=PAGE_LENGTH
options.description: set the page length to PAGE_LENGTH (66) lines (default number of lines of text 56, and with -F 63). implies -t if PAGE_LENGTH <= 10

options.title: -m, --merge
options.description: print all files in parallel, one in each column, truncate lines, but join lines of full length with -J

options.title: -m, --merge
options.description: print all files in parallel, one in each column, truncate lines, but join lines of full length with -J

options.title: -n[SEP[DIGITS]], --number-lines[=SEP[DIGITS]]
options.description: number lines, use DIGITS (5) digits, then SEP (TAB), default counting starts with 1st line of input file

options.title: -n[SEP[DIGITS]], --number-lines[=SEP[DIGITS]]
options.description: number lines, use DIGITS (5) digits, then SEP (TAB), default counting starts with 1st line of input file

options.title: -N, --first-line-number=NUMBER
options.description: start counting with NUMBER at 1st line of first page printed (see +FIRST_PAGE)

options.title: -N, --first-line-number=NUMBER
options.description: start counting with NUMBER at 1st line of first page printed (see +FIRST_PAGE)

options.title: -o, --indent=MARGIN
options.description: offset each line with MARGIN (zero) spaces, do not affect -w or -W, MARGIN will be added to PAGE_WIDTH

options.title: -o, --indent=MARGIN
options.description: offset each line with MARGIN (zero) spaces, do not affect -w or -W, MARGIN will be added to PAGE_WIDTH

options.title: -r, --no-file-warnings
options.description: omit warning when a file cannot be opened

options.title: -r, --no-file-warnings
options.description: omit warning when a file cannot be opened

options.title: -s[CHAR], --separator[=CHAR]
options.description: separate columns by a single character, default for CHAR is the <TAB> character without -w and 'no char' with -w. -s[CHAR] turns off line truncation of all 3 column options (-COLUMN|-a -COLUMN|-m) except -w is set

options.title: -s[CHAR], --separator[=CHAR]
options.description: separate columns by a single character, default for CHAR is the <TAB> character without -w and 'no char' with -w. -s[CHAR] turns off line truncation of all 3 column options (-COLUMN|-a -COLUMN|-m) except -w is set

options.title: -S[STRING], --sep-string[=STRING]
options.description: separate columns by STRING, without -S: Default separator <TAB> with -J and <space> otherwise (same as -S" "), no effect on column options

options.title: -S[STRING], --sep-string[=STRING]
options.description: separate columns by STRING, without -S: Default separator <TAB> with -J and <space> otherwise (same as -S" "), no effect on column options

options.title: -t, --omit-header
options.description: omit page headers and trailers; implied if PAGE_LENGTH <= 10

options.title: -t, --omit-header
options.description: omit page headers and trailers; implied if PAGE_LENGTH <= 10

options.title: -T, --omit-pagination
options.description: omit page headers and trailers, eliminate any pagination by form feeds set in input files

options.title: -T, --omit-pagination
options.description: omit page headers and trailers, eliminate any pagination by form feeds set in input files

options.title: -v, --show-nonprinting
options.description: use octal backslash notation

options.title: -v, --show-nonprinting
options.description: use octal backslash notation

options.title: -w, --width=PAGE_WIDTH
options.description: set page width to PAGE_WIDTH (72) characters for multiple text-column output only, -s[char] turns off (72)

options.title: -w, --width=PAGE_WIDTH
options.description: set page width to PAGE_WIDTH (72) characters for multiple text-column output only, -s[char] turns off (72)

options.title: -W, --page-width=PAGE_WIDTH
options.description: set page width to PAGE_WIDTH (72) characters always, truncate lines, except -J option is set, no interference with -S or -s

options.title: -W, --page-width=PAGE_WIDTH
options.description: set page width to PAGE_WIDTH (72) characters always, truncate lines, except -J option is set, no interference with -S or -s

options.title: --help
options.description: display this help and exit

options.title: --version
options.description: output version information and exit
